body.p: Respondents to the 2004 ED generally supported the proposal to extend the requirements on multi‑employer plans to group entities. However, many disagreed with the criteria proposed in the 2004 ED, for the following reasons:

li.p: The proposed amendments and the interaction with D6 (see paragraphs BC35–BC38) were unclear.
The provisions for multi‑employer accounting should be extended to a listed parent company.
The provisions for multi‑employer accounting should be extended to group entities with listed debt.
The provisions for multi‑employer plan accounting should be extended to all group entities, including partly‑owned subsidiaries.
There should be a blanket exemption from defined benefit accounting for all group entities.
